channel.title: [PI] I want it to notify the person that they are unmuted. HELP!

item.title: [PI] I want it to notify the person that they are unmuted. HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

Why would you want to loop this command?

[code=java]
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“unmute”)) {
try {
String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(7);
Connection.unMuteUser(playerToBan);
Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i];
c2.sendMessage("You have been unmuted by " + c.playerName);
} catch(Exception e) {
c.sendMessage(“Player Must Be Offline.”);

			}			
		}

[/code]This might work.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] I want it to notify the person that they are unmuted. HELP!

item.title: [PI] I want it to notify the person that they are unmuted. HELP!
item.dc:creator: @grimpkz1 grimpkz1
item.description:
@grimpkz1 wrote:

I want it so that when I unmute someone they get the message saying c2.sendMessage("You have been unmuted by " + c.playerName);.

I added the of Client 2 and the for loop and stuff but I get some errors, any smart people out there know the correct way of doing this I’d appreciate it.

This is the already made unmute command I have:

[code] if (playerCommand.startsWith(“unmute”)) {
try {
String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(7);
Connection.unMuteUser(playerToBan);
} catch(Exception e) {
c.sendMessage(“Player Must Be Offline.”);

			}			
		}[/code]

Thanks.
